intro: Pentameris collinita, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Pentameris collinita is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas, where it thrives in full sun.
